title: Quickest way of traveling in Bangkok !
review: After using Tuk Tuk taxied we tried the BTS  In Bangkok there is always rush hours  Always traffic jams  So Bts is the best and the quickest way to travel in this city  All the trains are with air condition systems which is great  The staff and also all people help you if you have any questions regarding traveling to any place   You always buy the tickets in the machines and usually you can buy them in a tickets box located in the stations In few of the stations at some hours you cannot buy tickets from tickets box but only to change for coins and then use the machines What I found uncomfortable was two things  1 You must buy tickets in the station you travel from They do not sell 2 ways tickets But line wasn't to bad and went fast all times 2 I was with a baby stroller so in some stations you do not have escalatorslifts There were lifts however the lifts were locked It looked quit new so they might open them soon Generally this was the best way to travel
opinion: The best way to travel, great air conditioning, helpful staff, convenient ticket machines.

title: Good experience with BTS bangkok
review: Most time I take taxi from airport to hotel and other places  but long queuing  and miscommunication with taxi driver  and often over charge by the taxi  traffic jam   so one day I try ask one western foreigner teach me how to use local bts from airport to hotel  and supprisingly is not difficult at all  and not crowded like in Hong Kong Mrt too  here bts is very clean  have air Con  English sign and map too  safe and clean  and very cheap too  almost cover all impotent location in bangkok  am not sure they operate 24 hours or not  but I did use one time at night around 11  they still operate  well it is really good transportation for foeringer to use  especially for female traveler is more safe  when you do not understand about the road and can not speak thai language  cause I had many times been drive around by taxi driver  and he keep drive refuse to stop and do not respond my English at all  and that was very scary feeling when you were alone sit inside car and no ideal where you were  so be careful before you take taxi  make sure the driver understand English and local 911 number keep with in your mobile phone  but over rall  bangkok is exciting city to discover  just try learn to be more smart and wise to spent your money on  best experience
opinion: BTS is a safe, clean, and cheap transportation option in Bangkok, especially for female travelers who may not speak Thai or understand the roads.

title: Best skytrain service
review: The BTS Skytrain is a Bon for the tourists They are very comfortable and commute to every corner of the city in Bangkok at a very nominal charges The best advice I can give is to click a picture of the base station and while coming back you can show the picture at the ticket counter and heshe will give you the ticket and guide you to the track the train would come

title: Convenient at most.
review: The metro is mostly crowded as is the norm in several Asian countries It connects a good part of the city but not all the major part of the network is under construction I think The connectivity from the Suvarnabhumi to the Bangkok city is also very convenient and economical and the metro is mostly empty at the initial few metro stations I used the Rome2Rio app to help me guide through for getting from Point A to Point B It provided with the best route options along with the prices The second also the older Don Muang Airport Bangkok doesn't have the direct connectivity with the metro from the City But one can get A1 Line Airport Bus on an hourly basis from Mo Chit Metro Station It costs around 30 Thai Baht
opinion: The metro is mostly empty at the initial few metro stations.

title: Easy mode of transport
review: Easy to navigate fairly cheap and gets you to places Gets very crowded at peak hours but definitely better than being caught in Bangkok's notorious traffic jams
opinion: Easy to navigate, fairly cheap and gets you to places

title: Packed like a tin of sardines
review: The thing i like the most about the BTS is that it is overgroundyou can catch views It is fast and efficient too  While the rest of the tourists struggle haggling with tuk tuks and taxi driversyou can reach your destination at a fraction of the cost and time  That said it is not ideal during busy hours as it is used by city commuters as it rightly should If you attempt it during office start and end hoursyou will be a sardinemake no doubts And yesdont attempt it with kids at that time  I liked the ticketing machines No fussa number is mentioned agains the station you need to head to Select that number and drop coins in the slot If you are short of change the ticket counter obliges
opinion: Liked the ticketing machines, no fuss

title: Excellent connectivity around Bangkok
review: BTS is the most convenient way to get around in Bangkok It's low cost and very fast as it is true with any metro rail system these days One thing that surprised me was the frequency of trains I did not wait in any of the stations for more than a minute before the train arrived  The stations were really clean and officers very helpful be it at the counter or the ones who did security check on our way to airport I also liked the fact that the connectivity to airport was so smooth that I will never take a taxi again to SVB airport unless I am carrying heavy luggage   One is the best rail systems I have seen in recent times in a metro
opinion: BTS is the most convenient way to get around in Bangkok It's low cost and very fast The frequency of trains was surprising The stations were really clean and officers very helpful I liked the connectivity to the airport One of the best rail systems I have seen

title: Confusing at times
review: This was our mode of transportation in Bangkok and the trains run like every 10 minutes  I got one of those cards that you can load but note that when you reload it there's a minimum of 100 baht  The card was very useful because you don't have to fall in line to buy tickets  The only thing I don't like about their system is (1) sometimes there are no escalators so you have to take the stairs and (2) the signs where the train is heading is sometimes not the end destination sometimes it is the famous stop I think  So for example I wanted to go to silom from national stadium so I looked at the map and it showed I have to take the train that goes to Wong wian (final destination) When I got to the platform I didn't see Wong Wian but I saw sathorn and mochit  Luckily I went to mochit the other day and I know it's for chatuchak so I took the risk and took the train that heads to sathorn  When I got in the train I noticed that Sathorn is like a stop where you can transfer to another train  So as a tip bring a map with you or download it on your phone  It will be very handy while you travel
opinion: The card was very useful because you don't have to fall in line to buy tickets

title: Fast and cheap mode of transportation
review: Travelled to Bangkok for a short stay and have already read a lot about BTS and MRT  As I wanted to travel like a local on a shoestring budget I thought to use the 1 Day unlimited travel pass to explore the things on my own  Pros  1 Clean stations 2 Good security checks 3 Easy navigations onboard the train 4 On time performance (Luckily there was no breakdown or delay during my visit) 5 Announcements in local as well as English language 6 Gives beautiful view of the city  Cons   1 Some stations may not be accessible with  escalators either side you need to walk through the stairs or the to catch the escalators you need to climb some steps manually  2 As I am coming from Singapore I expected 1 pass to work through all the public transportation system(atleast the metro rail if not on the buses) but I understood a BTS pass cannot be used on MRT  ProTip  1 Apply for 1 day unlimited pass at 140 baht to explore the whole of BTS  2 If coming from Don Muang Airport Airport Bus 543 at 30 baht to Mochit station and then BTS to your stay will be useful combination  3 If planning to explore Grand Palace and Temples alight at Saphan Taksin BTS Ferry Charge is 1520 Baht per person from Saphan Taksin BTS to the pier 8 from which you can walk to Grand Palace and the famous temples  4 A stay near BTS Asok is helpful for those willing to explore Sukhumvit Areas   5 BTS Asok is walkable to Sukhumvit MRT Terminal 21 Mall and other Nightlife Attractions  6 Ekkamai and Morchit BTS stations have Bus Terminals to transit to Pattaya  7 If you have plans to goto Pattaya it will be nearer to goto Ekkamai BTS from Asok  Do let me know if you found my review helpful‚ò∫Ô∏è
opinion: Clean stations

title: very helpful
review: The BTS Skytrain can be very crowded but there are frequent trains at all stations very handy and inexpensive
opinion: Frequent trains at all stations are very handy and inexpensive.

title: So easy!
review: I loved having the BTS available in Bangkok When you arrive at a station you buy your ticket from a ticket machine There's a map with a price next to each stop next to the machine Choose the amount on the ticket machine and put coins in If you don't have coins you can get change from the office You take your ticket and slide it into the turnstile Hang on to it because you need to put it in when you get to your destination It is great to fly over all of the traffic on the roads The BTS is super clean and quick (no eating or drinking in the stations or on the train) I only wish there were more lines that took you to more places like the temples
opinion: The BTS is super clean

title: No better way to travel around Bangkok
review: There really is no better way to travel around Bangkok than by using the BTS Skytrain It is fast efficient and so convenient  There are 2 lines that connect at Siam and my advice is to try to secure accommodation closer to the Skytrain as you will be able to move around the city above the traffic below  You can buy single tickets but make sure that you have coins to by these(change is available at the offices) however the simplest is the local Rabbit Card with as much Thai Baht as you think you will need and then just tap your card on the terminals as you pass through  The Skytrain is above the streets Most stations do have an escalator on both sides of the roads and lifts are also now being installed  The trains are regular super air conditioned and only crowded at rush air Use the Skytrain and enjoy more from Bangkok
opinion: The BTS Skytrain is fast, efficient, and convenient.

title: Great way to get around
review: Fast efficient and on time The BTS is the way I get around the city it is great Comfortable the AC definitely works and it is clean   Avoid the tragic and negotiations with tuk tuks and taxis The BTS in combination with the MRT can get you to most of the downtown core Use some boat taxis and you move freely around the city

title: Excellent....at the moment!
review: Skytrain (or BTS as everyone refers to i) is the the cleanest cheapest and safest way to travel in Bangkok  albeit the network is limited but growing  In fact it is a victim of its success as "rush hour" now extends through much of the day  The trains are very frequent but still crowded  They should add a carriage to each train (the platforms are long enough and marked for extra carriages)  However still BTS should be your preferred means of transport in Bangkok
opinion: BTS is the safest way to travel in Bangkok

title: Good. Could be better.

opinion: Skytrain is a great mode of transportation, a cheap way to escape Bangkok traffic jams.

title: One of the best mode for transport in Bangkok,
review: I could only wish that they build all the remaining land transport in Bangkok and suburbs faster It's one of the two modes of transportation in Bangkok that you can control you time schedule It's very convenient for those who need to move to any place along its routes At the moment the connections with MRT (underground subway) make public transportation in Bangkok a much better choice You absolutely avoid all the traffic on any Bangkok street
opinion: Very convenient for those who need to move to any place along its routes

title: Good connectivity
review: I am staying at sukhumvit area near to asok station During the travel i use the train everyday Its cheap and efficient To don mueng airport we only pay 42baht from asok to mo mo chit station And then use bus with label A1 or A2 to airport Fee is 30 baht Less than an hour you can reach the airport
opinion: Cheap and efficient.

title: Excellent and cheap service
review: Bangkok shows us how it's done we paid ¬£1 to go approx 8 stops   Trains are clean regular and worth using to get around Bangkok Far cheaper than any other mode of transport
opinion: Bangkok shows us how it's done  we paid ¬£1 to go approx 8 stops   Trains are clean regular and worth using to get around Bangkok Far cheaper than any other mode of transport

title: Brilliant and cool way to travel across Bangkok
review: We love the Skytrain even when it's packed with commuters and you find yourself hanging on to stay upright as the train accelerates leaving and slows approaching stations But you are not alone and everyone takes it in their stride The speed with which the trains travel never means you are on your feet for long The trains are clean and they have air conditioning With TripAdvisor as a guide you can always find something worthwhile visiting at most stops
opinion: The trains are clean and they have air conditioning.

title: very punctual
review: The BTS service is excellent to know BKK Tip find a hotel close to the BTS station so you can go around the city very cheap
opinion: Excellent to know

title: The best public transport in the world?
review: We used the Skytrain every day since we arrived four days ago It's a brilliant system Easy to purchase tickets clean as a whistle fast Everyone is respectful No food allowed so no soiled carriages People stand up for our children to sit down (despite protestations) It's really an amazing experience when you're used to Melbourne's comparatively filthy trains and regular scheduling issues (every Skytrain comes at 7 minute intervals) And there's an orderly line for each arriving train Unbelievable
opinion: Clean as a whistle

title: Best way around.
review: Fast clean and safe the best way to reach most of the city without the traffic hassle  Connects easily with the subway and the airport link and when used together with motorbike taxis makes moving around a breathe  Although the latter is not for everybody
opinion: Safe

title: Best way around.
review: Fast clean and safe the best way to reach most of the city without the traffic hassle  Connects easily with the subway and the airport link and when used together with motorbike taxis makes moving around a breathe  Although the latter is not for everybody
opinion: Fast, clean and safe

title: What would Bangkok travel be like without it!?
review: Cheap and direct access to useful places such as on nut for tesco shopping and ekamai for kids stuff Can't buy return tickets so try to buy a ticket as soon as disembark for return Not many stations take notes but change queues not too bad Rush hour is pretty jammed but better than London Central line Always move away from doors it's expected People give up seats for young children to sit Politeness is essential Soon to be extended down near Bang Poo which will be fortuitous
opinion: Cheap and direct access to useful places

title: Clean, climatised, secure and easy
review: While often the taximeters can be less expensive if you travel in family the BTS is a secure and quicker way to move in an often trafficjam'd city
opinion: BTS is a secure way to move.

title: Clean, climatised, secure and easy
review: While often the taximeters can be less expensive if you travel in family the BTS is a secure and quicker way to move in an often trafficjam'd city
opinion: BTS is a secure and quicker way to move in an often traffic-jammed city

title: Always running on time
review: The Bts or the above ground Train service runs regularly  It connects to the Mrt (underground train) at Asok Bts You can buy the tickets from the ticket machine which requires change and they only give one ticket at a time one way In some train stations there are ticket machines that takes paper money and can buy more then one ticket The people serving at the station counter don't sell tickets only give you change so don't line up thinking you can purchase a ticket from them The pricing starts at 15 baht The trains are very clean When waiting you have to line up and if it's full you have to wait for the next train The Thai's are very courteous using the trains there is no hustling
opinion: The trains are very clean

title: World-class commuting experience!
review: The best and fastest way to go around Bangkok at most affordable prices If you're planning on taking any more than 3 or 4 rides in a day better to go for a full day pass costing 140 Baht  which is excellent value for money You can easily find change of money at the station counters and its very easy to find your way around the station and buying the tickets is indeed very easy The trains are worldclass in every way  punctual spotlessly clean and very comfortable Please help keep it that way please don't litter and please be polite to the amazing people of Thailand
opinion: The trains are punctual

title: Bangkok's best mode of transportation
review: I don't know why this is reviewable as an attraction but sure why not Whether you're in Bangkok for a day or a year there's virtually no way to get from place to place without taking this The major roads are far too clogged to make getting around via taxi viable It's extremely clean on par with Singapore's MRT and well airconditioned And trains come very frequently I don't think I've ever had to wait more than 58 minutes for one  It's also very easy to navigate There are only two different lines and there are signs and displays everywhere within the train and outside of it to clearly mark which station you're at at any given time  The only negative is that it can get very crowded during peak hours but that's true of public transit in any major city Much better to take this than a car unless you want to sit stuck in traffic forever
opinion: It's extremely clean on par with Singapore's MRT

title: convenient, fast,cheap and clean.
review: I chose to stay at a hotel which near BTS and it made my life in Bangkok much easier to move around and do my business and errands Great transportation for travelers to use BTS instead of Taxi safe fast and convenient
opinion: Great transportation for travelers to use BTS instead of Taxi safe fast and convenient

title: The Perfect way to Shopping around center of Bangkok

opinion: Recommend to use skywalk that corresponded to aspect: Cleanliness

title: The Perfect way to Shopping around center of Bangkok

title: The BTS Skytrain, Bangkok
review: Safe reliable cheap and frequent    Easy to use although I'd recommend getting an addvalue Smart Pass though  takes all the stress of getting the right tickets every time you travel away and any value you add seems to stay valid indefinitely   I bought one years ago and didn't go back for maybe a couple of years after buying the pass and the value was still there and it worked perfectly    There are stations at frequent intervals along all the main routes and it's a pretty good system     It's always very crowded so be prepared for that    And being a Skytrain the platforms are high up and involve a lot of stairs    There aren't always escalators or lifts going both up and down so you need to be fairly fit to use the service
opinion: Safe and reliable

title: Best and Fastest Way to Get Around Bangkok!
review: The BTS Skytrain is one of the best mass transit systems I have encountered throughout the world  It's fast comfortable (if it's not rush hour) and very inexpensive  It doesn't cover all the areas of Bangkok but it does get to some of the most popular shopping and entertainment areas  I use it very regularly
opinion: It's fast, comfortable (if it's not rush hour), and very inexpensive. I use it very regularly.

opinion: Very easy way to get around Bangkok

title: Great Way of Transportation Around Bangkok
review: Cheap fast easy What more can one ask for  The BTS Skytrain and MRT trains are a great way to travel through Bangkok but you'll have to make do with walking or grabbing a taxituk tuk if you want to travel around the Old City    I found the MRT to be the easiest to travel around when it came to hauling luggage to and from the airport but the BTS and Skytrain are good as well Just take note that some stations have escalators going up but no escalators going down so you may have to drag your luggage down the stairs (hence why I preferred the MRT they have escalators going in both directions at every station) Also take note that the Skytrain carriages are fewer in number so it gets more crowded (and hence a bit more difficult to travel with luggage) especially at Siam station and during rush hour (5PM to 8PM)   A phenomenon that you may be interested in takes place at 8AM and 6PM everyday Siam is a good place to witness it )
opinion: Cheap fast easy

title: Efficient anf fast, but limited reach
review: Best way to get around in Bangkok since roads are usually too much congested Use the trains or water transport if you don't want to waste your holiday on the road BTS is very efficient good frequency neat and fast Only problem is that the line does not reach attractions on the West so you have to change to a bus or cab or boat or walk if you are coming from the Sukhumvit side and want to go to Wat Arun area
opinion: BTS is very efficient, good frequency, neat and fast

title: Best way to get around Bangkok and other parts
review: I always use the BTS whenever I am in Bangkok It's cheap convenient and saves you a lot of time as Bangkok is notorious for its traffic jam If you couple BTS with MRT you can pretty much cover most of Bangkok by train alone  all you need to know is which station you need to get down One note though  the train starts at 630  and the last one leaves between 2330 and 2350 Fares start at 15 baht for one stop  that's pretty cheap
opinion: Cheap, convenient, saves time.

title: Great way to travel around but not during busy hour!
review: Pros BTS Skytrain is a great way to travel Bangkok hotel (intercontinental holiday inn and more) shopping destination (chatucak market siam paragon platinum and more) and tourist spot (aquarium at siam paragon and more) It's cheap fast and clean  Cons However it's not recommend to travel during busy hour since there are so many people there while the station is pretty small You can purchase the ticket at automatic ticket machine but you need to have coin (you can't pay with paper money change at automatic ticket machine) You can pay with big change or with paper money only at ticket counter Beware most place only have 2 counters open so you need to prepare a Long queue during traffic hour  Using BTS Skytrain can be a problem for people using wheels chair or small kids with baby stroller since some of the station not providing any lifts and escalators They only give access by stairs at those station
opinion: BTS Skytrain is cheap, fast and clean. It's not recommend to travel during busy hour since there are so many people there.Using BTS Skytrain can be a problem for people using wheels chair or small kids with baby stroller since some of the station not providing any lifts and escalators.

title: Practical, clean, cheap and safe
review: Hi all I recommend using the BTS Skytrain as much as you can It's a great way to see the city I'm scared of heights but it' is high but not that high ) At the moment if you buy a RABBIT CARD it'll give you a reduced price More importantly  you'll have quicker access at the station you won't have to queue at the ticket machines I bought mine at a BTS station Just ask the person working at the booth For a week I used about 300 Bath (I never took taxis) You can top up the card the same way If you return the card they give you a 50 Bath deposit back Happy travels    * BTW when you get a RABBIT CARD you have to choose if you want it for the Skytrain (the train a little up in the air) or MRT (underground route)
opinion: Recommends using the BTS Skytrain for convenience.

title: BTS - most convenient way to travel
review: The BTS is really easy to use and covers most of the popular areas of the city I combine the BTS with the river boats which covers other places not accessible by BTS I bought a pass I think the deposit is 100 BHT and the card cost another 100 BHT Most trips are 25 to 30 BHT Be careful not to bend the card I had the card in my back pocket so it was slightly bent When I tried to return it for my deposit they refused to accept the card The card was still usable as I had been using it all the while although slight bent I also like the BTS as it doesn't have to contend with traffic jams Peak hours can be very crowded though but I always managed to squeeze in
opinion: The BTS is really easy to use and covers most of the popular areas of the city.

title: A boon for the city with horrible traffic
review: the first thing you observe once you reach Bangkok roads is that the traffic everywhere is horrible at office times especially on Friday the roads are choked to an extend that a 25 km travel may take a good 15 hours to 2 hours of time Considering this the BTS skytrain is a boon to the city which keeps you out of traffic and helps you reach your destination in time at rush hours the trains are crowded so bringing in big luggage will not be a good idea The stations are good and mostly easy accessible
opinion: The BTS skytrain is a boon to the city and helps you reach your destination in time.

title: Convenient and not convenient
review: I have tried the BTS from the airport to Thonglor it was convenient and not convenient as well The vending machine does not accept note and only coins even for kids need pay full price For most countries the senior and kids pay half The vending machine has no multitickets function you need to buy ticket one by one If you have more than three people to go you take a taxi will be cheaper It is fast than taxi as no traffic jam Another thing not convenient is the BTS are three stories level above the gound floor we have to walk down and no escalators or lifts for going down I carried very heavy luggage and not convenient at all
opinion: The vending machine does not accept notes and only coins even for kids need pay full price. The vending machine has no multitickets function you need to buy ticket one by one.  The BTS are three stories level above the ground floor we have to walk down and no escalators or lifts for going down.

title: BTS
review: You can go anywhere (almost) by BTS  You may want to consider getting a 199 bht travel card  Not sure what the deal is but there are posters all around the station  Coins are required for most automated ticketing machines so you may want to keep some coins handy  Otherwise you can always get change from station control  Beats waiting in the Bangkok jam in a taxi
opinion: Not sure what the deal is but there are posters all around the station

title: Fast clean and on time!

title: Simply Fantastic Transport
review: If you want to get around Bangkok easily and quickly above the chokedcongested road transport you cannot beat the Skytrain  Get a map and see exactly where the many stations are being limited to a NorthSouth line and an EastWest line but with both lines being further extended   Cost is reasonable  maximum from one extremity of Bangkok to the other is 52 Baht ($2) but shorter distances much less   Easy system to understand dual language signage throughout really clean and efficient public transport   Great way to get to Weekend Market at the Northern line extremity
opinion: Easy system to understand, dual language signage throughout, really clean and efficient public transport.

title: Easy

opinion: Terrific, easy to use, runs very regularly

title: Convenience means of transport in Bangkok
review: At first I used a Limo from Airport to the hotel traffic gets horrible sometimesand I got into one of this traffics  A 1 hour drive became 3hrs and that was a good lesson as from then I asked about alternative means of transport and BTS skytrain became handy it will take you to many of the places in bangkok it si very clean with working air condition there is one after every 5 minutes so you dont stay waiting for too long On my way back i used BTS skytrain from my hotel to the airportthere is no traffic jams with BTS skytrain and hence more convenient way if you want to get somewhere on time  It is cheaper too it costed me 69BHT (2$) for the same distance which costed 1200BHT (39$) with a limo   Taxi use taximeters the drivers are so naughty they will take long route unnecessarily and or go at a lower speed just to make you pay more  I recommend BTS Skytrain as your convenientsafe and cheap means of transportation while in bangkok
opinion: BTS Skytrain is convenient, safe and cheap.

title: Great way to get around
review: Once you have the system figured out this is a great way to get around In Thailand I generally find 95% of people friendly and helpful however this was not my experience on the Skytrain so be prepared When you arrive on the station there are people sitting behind windows but they do not dispense tickets they only give out change for the ticket machines It took a while to work out where I wanted to go and how to use the machine but once done it's easy
opinion: Not friendly or helpful staff

title: Fastest way to get around bangkok
review: If you're visiting Bangkok it is worth using the sky train You can get from one station to the next in under 4 mins   The fare is fairly cheap You pay according to the station you are traveling too 55bhat was the most  It is great to use at peak traffic times as Bangkok traffic is awful   The doors do open and close very quickly and do not wait for anyone as my friend found out So you must make sure you are ready to jump out  Much like the underground in London but with air con
opinion: The sky train is convenient.

title: Useful
review: Really useful for getting around the city eg to the MBK mall and other parts of Bangkok good value
opinion: Really useful for getting around the city

title: It Was Efficient.
review: The Skytrain was clean and it helped me commute to several places in Bangkok The intervals between stations were okay but I felt that the interchange station was a bit of a distance A great tip If you're planning to come to Bangkok I'd recommend staying around Siam or a few stops away from Siam This will save you a lot of time travelling from one place to another I didn't take that into consideration while planning for my trip to Bangkok I ended up staying 11 stations away  from the interchange station and I lost so much time while travelling Well of course it also depends on where you would be travelling to If you're only going to travel around the place that you stay in I guess this tip doesn't apply to you
opinion: The Skytrain was clean

title: The only way to travel fast.
review: Living on sukhumvit this really is the only way to get around fast As I been on the skytrain almost daily for the past 3 years now there has been delays no more than twice Can be super crowded at peak hours Just wait for the next train they come within minutes Never have to wait more than 5 10 min even if you don't get on the first train I would recommend everyone to get a "Rabbit" card Pre paid tickets and also work as payment in many shops Will save you time at the station even if you are just here for a few days  Some stations are of course more busy than others Asoke is really crowded at peak hours as it connects to the underground Mrt train But I can't imagine how it used to be too travel the city before it was built Unfortunately the two lines only cover so much of the city Mrt does extend the reach but menu places still require you to take taxi or bus to get to
opinion: The skytrain is convenient for getting around quickly.

title: Fly over traffic
review: I think this is one of the best Ideas for a Megatown like Bangkok although for family of 4 and more it might be less cost effective and taxi are cheaper the time you save worth it there are two ways to buy your ride look at the stations chart placed near the automatic machines inside the name of your destination there is a number this is the fare change at the office to 10 Baht coins or use the new digital machines that accepts notes (and can print multiple tickets) remember the name of the last station in the direction you need pass your card and go to the station you need (Named the last station) and wait a few minutes or less The other option is to have a magnetic prepaid card which deduct the fare from your balance (good option for people staying longer then a few days)    Keep your ticket to get out and keep your valuables supervised at all times (wallets in front pocket and hand on purse) it i very crowded and some may exploit it Stations are clearly announced both in Thai and English When arrived take a minute to understand which exit you need just look at the sings
opinion: This is one of the best ideas for a Megatown like Bangkok

title: Didn't use BTS? Are you kidding me?
review: You should use BTS to go round central BKK areas Especially if you are going tofrom Sukhumvit road From SiamParagon to anywhere to Thong Lor or more It's FAST and no traffic jam Trains are all airconditioned and clean Very safe and convenient I'm using taxi only if it's outside BTS area or if it's after midnight  Buy BTS "Rabbit" card it's *worth* your time it is fast and convenient to get on and off the train with "rabbit" card

title: Cheap and easy transport
review: The Skytrain was a surprise the first time I rode on it The trains are cheap clean air conditioned and frequent They can get crowded at times but are an efficient way of getting around BKK and out of the traffic If only the trains in Oz were as good
opinion: The trains are cheap clean air conditioned and frequent

title: BKK sky train
review: I had seen Bangkok before the sky trains and have seen it now When it was being built I thought it was an eyesore that took away a lot of the natural light and sight of the buildings facade and the sky above however I guess it was a necessity to alleviate the traffic congestions Today I got used to it being there and in fact enjoy using it the sky train combined with the tube train give you all the access you need to the city and saves you a great deal of time compared to Taxis The trains are safe clean and cheap and not much waiting time for the next train Many exhibitions are held on the elevated walkways which at times is a nice pass time Again using the sky train gives you the opportunity to see the city from a birds eye view and allows you to find places you weren't aware of Tickets can be bought from the windows or the automatic vending machines the fares are very easy to work out from the maps on the wallThe train operators allow younger children to accompany their parents through special automatic doors instead of the regular turnstiles which is very convenient for parents with young children or children in strollers the operators of both Sky and Tube trains are like the rest of the Thais very helpful and courteous Overall a plus for the city in fact I only use Taxis now to go to the airport
opinion: Enjoy using the sky train, combined with the tube train, gives you all the access you need to the city and saves you a great deal of time compared to Taxis

title: Nice to find some air con on a hot day
review: The Sky train is the best way to travel around Bangkok It can get extremely busy morning and evenings but during the day its not to bad The tickets system is a little confusing at first but once you have worked out the maps on the machines then it quite straight forward The trains are nice and clean and with the air con its a nice escape from the heat All the announcements are made in Thai and English so it makes it even easier not to miss your stop Make sure you pick up a map on the stations as they show you the roots and points of interest

title: Fastest and smartest way to move around a big metropolis
review: The Skytrain is a very modern transport system and the way it's run in Bangkok city makes it even more so for the following reasons   traffic on ground is quite intense and chaotic If you don't want to lose your head in the heat and chaos best bet is the skytrain   they are very well organised and fast rather than moving underground like the metro in Europe they move overhead and are therefore panoramic as well    they are very very clean as every public place and utility in Bangkok anyways  they are very cheap  the gap between the cost of skytrain tickets and regular taxis is an abyss  priority is given to children pregnant women old folks and anyone else who is on the weaker side What's new in this afterall it's the rule in every great city you might say The difference is that here this rule is abided by People just do the right thing
opinion: The Skytrain is very clean.

title: Generally, the best way to get around Bangkok.
review: The BTS Skytrain tends to be our preferred method of travel for getting around Bangkok on most occasions Although taxis are relatively cheap in Bangkok they are of course susceptible to the horrific traffic congestion that the city is famous for A consequence of that is at certain times of day taxi drivers are reluctant to go to some destinations Quite often the simple answer is to to take the ever present and ever reliable Skytrain and if need be complete the final part of your journey by taxi  The BTS system puts the London tube to shame quite frankly It is clean air conditioned and efficient not to mention CHEAP CHEAP The service is very regular and more stations are being constructed at the moment to integrate with the MRT national rail network Already there is a service from Bangkok's international Suvarnabumi airport although I must admit we have yet to try that journey  It is easy to purchase tickets at the BTS stations through the vending machines which although often busy are quick to use (assuming everyone in the queue already knows their destination having looked at the schematic maps that are conveniently posted around the ticket machines) The useful alternative is choose and purchase a credited travelcard from the station ticketing office These can be for one day one week multiple journeys etc There is a great choice of options  If you are intending to be using the Skytrain on and off over a long period the "BTS Sky Smartpass" is a useful option It can be topped up whenever necessary and cashed in on completion (as the credit amount doesn't expire) and it is a quick "touch and pass" entrance at the barriers  Getting to where you want to go is simple Once you are through the barriers there are station maps posted directly in front of you so that you can confirm which platform the go to (depending on which direction you wish to travel and at some of the connecting stations which BTS line you wish to take) On the trains above the doors there are station maps that are illuminated and pinpoint where you are during your journey as well as next station announcements   Access is possible for wheelchairs onto the trains and most if not all stations have lift access as well as the normal escalatorsWhen the system is busy there is a remarkably ordered manner for embarking the trains On the platforms queues form either side of where the train's doors will stop as marked on the platform and disembarking passengers are courteously allowed off before others embark   The Skytrain is a very efficient cheap and reliable service that the Thai people are quite rightly proud of and it is used by many as a routine method of travel I always find it a pleasure to use
opinion: The BTS system is clean and air conditioned

title: Wonderful Bangkok Skytrain!
review: For travellers whether for Business or Pleasure may I wholly recommend CENTERING your Bangkok visit on the excellent SKYTRAIN routes  Officially Bangkok has a population of 9  12 million The Real population is over 20 million There's never been a population Census so numbers are calculated on the amount of garbage the City collects (Really )  Bangkok's Traffic jams are the stuff of legend  Super Slow  Motorcycle taxi stands are everywhere cheap and fast but not much fun in the rain and a bit nervewracking  The canal networks offer speedy transits but take a lot of legend"knowing"  Just Google "Skytrain Bangkok" and a wonderful easy to follow world of clean fast and cheap routes  with truly Excellent Hotel choices to suit every pocket are yours for the canal choosing  The Skytrain links Suvarnabhumi  Bangkok's superb airport (pronounced  "Soo wannapoom") and cheap direct trains take only 20 minutes A wee warningyou can sadly have your luggage 'misplaced' if you check in at the Makkasan Terminus in Bangkok city  Use the Skytrain website to find a conveniently situated hotel check out Shopping stops sometimes right off the Skytrain platform and into the best Malls in the World  All the famous Temples and Palaces are made easily reachable thanks to the Skytrain  Rabbit Passes multipasses which save queueing  excellent value
opinion: The author highly recommends using the Skytrain for transportation in Bangkok due to its convenience, cleanliness, and affordability.

title: It is great if you are going where it goes.
review: Obtain a map from any station (free) and plot your trip You can obtain a permanent card if you are travelling a lot or you plan to return frequently You load on value and scan it each time you enter or leave the platforms Card stays valid for a considerable time (I have had mine for 4 years) Can be busy at certain times of day and getting a seat is a 50 50 chance at best Still most trips are not that long and it is cheap and frequent
opinion: Convenient to obtain a free map and plot your trip.

opinion: The Skytrain is convenient for traveling in Bangkok because it avoids traffic, is quick, clean, air-conditioned, and eliminates the need for parking.

title: The Good, the bad and the ugly
review: I am a longtime resident of Bangkok The BTS system known as the Skytrain is  like many things in Thailand  a good idea poorly executed It is most certainly a very fast way of getting around some areas of Bangkok but there are just two lines and there are vast areas of the city that is doesn't cover or even go near It is cheap to use but if you are a casual user and do not need a stored value ticket (like London's curiously named Oyster Card) you come up against the bizarre practise that the locals probably understand but others do not There are machines that dispense tickets but with most you need change So you have to queue at a window where an always polite employee will give you that change Then you queue again at a machine and buy the ticket easy with the fare chart showing the fare to each station The always polite staff who give you the change will also sell you a stored value or daily ticket but not sell you a single ride ticket As I say this probably makes perfect sense to the Thais but baffles everyone else So far so good The bad is that the system is grossly overcrowded often even outside of the rush hours and it is not unusual to have to let one or more trains go before you can squeeze on board The good here is that the longest wait between trains is five minutes and because the system is small the journey time for most is rarely more than 15 minutes or so Why it is so crowded is because the trains are far shorter than the platforms They have recently expanded from three car to four car trains but for 500000 riders a day that is absurd compared to other major cities round the world that have eight or 12 cars When it was built like the airport there was absolutely no thought given to how many would use it The ugly is that like in much of Thailand the company operates a racist pricing system Over 60s can get a discounted ticket outside of the rush hours but only if they are Thai The similar underground railway system allows anyone the discounted fare regardless of race I invited the BTS to explain and justify their policy but alI I received was a stony and predictable silence
opinion: Good idea poorly executed, fast but limited coverage, cheap but confusing ticket system, grossly overcrowded, short trains, racist pricing system.

title: Great Value
review: Getting around Bangkok on the Sky train is the only way to go It is very clean gets you to most of the attractions with trains every few minutes You can buy a day pass for 130 baht which gives you unlimited travel until 1200 pm excellent value Taxis are very cheap but the traffic is unbelievable Staff are all very helpful advising which station to get off at or openning barriers when carrying luggage Also very good for getting to either of the airports with connections either by airport link for Suvarnabhumi  or bus from Mo Chit for Don Muang Airport

title: A pleasant use in an otherwise congested city.
review: The Skytrain is hands down the fastest and most convenient way to travel around Bangkok We very quickly learned that taking a taxi or Tuk Tuk from anywhere along Sukumvit Rd ended in gridlock The Skytrain bypasses all that and proved to be a very efficient and reliable means of transpo Upon our departure to the international airport we took the Skytrain directly to the terminal a far cheaper and relaxing ride than a taxi
opinion: The Skytrain is hands down the fastest and most convenient way to travel around Bangkok

title: A Hop On Hop Off Sightseeing of Bangkok
review: Whether you have a full day or few hours the Bangkok Transit System or commonly known as the BTS can be a perfect choice to see the city  The BTS crossed in Siam Square where the Paragon Department Store is located and span across the Sukhumvit Road all the way to the JJ Market in one line also starts from MBK Mall to Sathorn Road across the Chao Phya River  Best to choose the route near your hotel and enjoy the sight and sound of Bangkok  The BTS starts sometime around 600 am however anytime after 900 am would be a good time to venture around town with BTS without having to fight for standing space on the sky train  There are few stops that are worthwhile to spend time in walking around eg Siam Square Saladaeng Asoke Taksing Bridge and the JJ Market  Before boarding check whether they have any promotion rate for tourist for that day  Even if you pay full price the experience is worth the cost of the ride  You may buy a ticket that allow you to hop on and hop off without having to buy new ticket which can be irritating
opinion: The Bangkok Transit System (BTS) is a great way to see the city.

title: Changed the City
review: The Skytrain allows you to plan meetings and arrive on time without hassle The system works efficiently is clean is safe and is well located for so much of Bangkok's business centres Buy a pass to save lining up for tickets and watch the fast closing gates as you walk through the gates Read the maps so you take the correct exit as the walkways can get you to most buildings in sheltered comfort Peak hour can be busy
opinion: The system is safe.

title: Best way to get around
review: A frequent and efficient way to get around and it covers the shopping and entertainmant areas of Silom (Sala Daeng) Siam Square and all the way along Sukhumvit Road the weekend market is at Mo Chit but you are better off using the MRT for this and getting off at Kamphaeng Phet which is right inside the market It is incredible to think that this has been in operation for more than 10 years  still so clean wellmaintained and graffittifree It is quite busy all of the day and probably should be avoided at rush hours Tickets are only available from coinoperated machines but the cashiers will give you change if you do not have the right coins  and currently the machines do not accept 2 baht coins The interchange station at Siam is very busy with queues to get on the escalators but its not too bad A bit expensive by Thai standards but should be within the budget of most travellers Tickets are not valid on the MRT (underground) and separate tickets have to be bought for this
opinion: It is incredible to think that this has been in operation for more than 10 years  still so clean wellmaintained and graffittifree

title: Great transportation
review: The skytrain is very useful in Bangkok it has aircon and is very clean It is also quite cheap and it crosses the main attractions in Bangkok especially the business center
opinion: The skytrain is very useful and convenient.

title: Easy to navigate, clean, safe, friendly.
review: A must for quickly navigating this traffic filled city  I even choose my hotel based on the proximity of the nearest BTS stop My favorite area to stay is close to the Chong Nonsi BTS
opinion: A must for quickly navigating this traffic filled city

title: Skytrain brings you everywhere
review: For europeans easy to manage One thing is the temperature in the trains  it could be 34 degrees higher When you come from outside you are really shocked about the low temperature inside
opinion: Shocked about the low temperature inside

title: Excellent Transport
review: The SkyTrain in Bangkok is the most effective and affordable way of getting around in Bangkok The stations are placed very convenient for shopping and site seeing Currently the SkyTrain doesn't cover the whole of Bangkok but then you can travel by the subway However the ticket systems for the two lines are not compatible and may create a little bit of irritation having to carry two different tickets
opinion: Effective and affordable way of getting around

title: Limited network but goes to most of the places you will want to!
review: Noisey with aggravating adverts blaring out and a limited route network which in fairness is being extended the skytrain offers am affordable quick and easy way to get to most if the key points in the city
opinion: Affordable, quick and easy way to get to most of the key points in the city

title: the only way to get where you need to go without any hassles.
review: in a city that is infamous for its chaotic traffic taking the BTS Skytrain eliminates all of that  trips across greater BKK that used to take 3+ hours are now easily and comfortably achieved in 30 minutes  although there are only 2 lines in operation currently for a tourist most locations of interest to tourists are reached by the BTS and even more when connecting with the MRT subway system  reasonably priced clean and sanitary air conditioned and rarely delayed the BTS has become the ride of choice for locals and tourists alike  discount cards for multiple trips are available as well  most staff speak understandable English
opinion: Eliminates all of that chaotic traffic, trips across greater BKK that used to take 3+ hours are now easily and comfortably achieved in 30 minutes

title: I wish all cities had the Skytrain
review: I very rarely use any other transport other than the Skytrain in Bangkok (BTS) It is fast efficient and cheap also means you can avoid the manic traffic  It is also very clean as you are not allowed any food or drink on board I have used the BTS with friends with family with my husband and also alone  I love it
opinion: It is very clean as you are not allowed any food or drink on board

title: I wish all cities had the Skytrain
review: I very rarely use any other transport other than the Skytrain in Bangkok (BTS) It is fast efficient and cheap also means you can avoid the manic traffic  It is also very clean as you are not allowed any food or drink on board I have used the BTS with friends with family with my husband and also alone  I love it
opinion: I love it that it is fast, efficient, and cheap.

title: Really good mass transit, with AC
review: Remember sweltering in traffic before BTS was operational  Now it's a breeze to get around With the subway and airport connections BKK has to have one of the better systems around  Minuses  watch out for rush hour as you may not be able to board  Some stations do not have escalators or elevators up  Hauling luggage can be a struggle  Station agents are very helpfulGet the multiple ride pass and skip the ticket machines
opinion: Station agents are very helpful

title: Excellent
review: Great service Highly recommended All the train are clean and nice on cool One of my favourite thing in Bangkok

title: Excellent
review: Great service Highly recommended All the train are clean and nice on cool One of my favourite thing in Bangkok
opinion: Great service

title: Skytrain Effeciency
review: I have been using the Skytrain in Bangkok since its inception  This is a clean efficient inexpensive and reliable mode of transport  In conjunction with the MRT this is the only way to get around Bangkok and avoid the traffic jams
opinion: This is a clean efficient inexpensive and reliable mode of transport

title: Best value
review: Bangkok sky train like many major cities is the best way to travel safe clean and assistance available in English the only draw back is many of the sign direction at stations can be misleading They are written with the assumption the traveler knows the direction what I mean is you will get to many plant forms with just 23 minutes to orientate yourself There are not train personnel on the platform to assist you if you find yourself lost The prices are great But buy through the machines can be worrisome dependent upon the type and age of the machine Each terminal is loaded with "back packers" who in my opinion are the best source of help and information Sky train is safe clean and Well maintained
opinion: The Bangkok sky train is safe, clean, and well-maintained.

title: Best value
review: Bangkok sky train like many major cities is the best way to travel safe clean and assistance available in English the only draw back is many of the sign direction at stations can be misleading They are written with the assumption the traveler knows the direction what I mean is you will get to many plant forms with just 23 minutes to orientate yourself There are not train personnel on the platform to assist you if you find yourself lost The prices are great But buy through the machines can be worrisome dependent upon the type and age of the machine Each terminal is loaded with "back packers" who in my opinion are the best source of help and information Sky train is safe clean and Well maintained
opinion: Bangkok sky train is safe and clean

title: Getting around town
review: The BTS is the most convenient way to get around this very busy city It is fast  efficient and very  clean If you staying for a while buy the BTS card and top it up saves so much time when traveling too many long queue's at the ticket machines
opinion: The BTS is the most convenient way to get around

title: Getting around town
review: The BTS is the most convenient way to get around this very busy city It is fast  efficient and very  clean If you staying for a while buy the BTS card and top it up saves so much time when traveling too many long queue's at the ticket machines
opinion: Very clean

title: BTS _ SKYTRAIN
review: The BTS is the fastest way to visit the BKK Center avoiding traffic and waste of time queuing around ticket costs 15 to 45  60 bath depending from your departure point major shopping mall are located directly in the BTS exits in Phrom Phong (Emporiun) Asok (Terminal 21)  Chit Lom (Central)  Siam (Paragon) and National Stadium (MBK)
opinion: The BTS is the fastest way to visit the BKK Center

title: Love it
review: Fastest way to move around city  Be sure to have plenty of coins in advance coz tickets are bought in machines and queues for exchanging bills for coins can be pretty big
opinion: Queues for exchanging bills for coins can be pretty big

title: very convenient.
review: Skytrain is very convenient and not expensive Air conditioned too Adverts may be a little loud but that's a Thai thing Good service to and from the airport too
opinion: Skytrain is very convenient

title: Skytrain the fastest way to move in Bangkok.
review: The best and fastest way to travel in Bangkok as long as your destination is not too far from the lines It is possible to get "one day pass" for 120 bath per person pe day
opinion: The best and fastest way to travel in Bangkok as long as your destination is not too far from the lines

title: Perfect way to travel around bkk
review: Perfect way to travel around bkk it can get ver crowded at times around 810am & 47pm when ppl are traveling to and from work
opinion: Perfect way to travel around bkk

title: best way to get around
review: provided you want to go fromto a place on the line there are no faster or more convenient way to travel in bkk you fly over the jam get a rabbit card to avoid the quest on rush hour
opinion: No faster or more convenient way to travel in BKK.

title: Skytrain
review: Skytrain (BTS) is a very convenient transport in Bangkok the local traffic in Bangkok is worse and worse you get in the skytrain without delay to your destination  You can transfer from BTS to MRT (Subway) and  or Airport Rail Link  BTS  operates daily from 0600 ‚Äì 2400 hrs
opinion: Skytrain (BTS) is a very convenient transport in Bangkok

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: There are many ways to get around Bangkok scooter taxi tuk tuk river taxi and regular taxi but by far the best and air conditioned as well is the skytrain Fast and reliable clean and cheap
opinion: Skytrain is the best and most convenient way to get around Bangkok.

title: I am a resident here in Thailand and Lived in Bangkok for 7 years. Now I live in the NorthEast province of Ubon Ratchath
review: The Sky train is a the local city transport system and they also have the underground called the MRT Both services pretty much covers Bangkok Very easy to get around in  Its better to use this service than taxi or bus because the traffic is horrendous in the city Reading the train map and connections is very easy The staff at the stations are very help this also includes the security guards who are all eager to help with a smile    The trains fares vary from destination to destination and all electronic ticket style card machines are in English as well You just cannot get lost The train system is not as big as London or New York but it serves Bangkok well  As mentioned I am a full time resident here in Thailand so the dates that has been mentioned  is incorrect because that's how far the tripadvisor goes back to August 2012 I have been here since February 2004
opinion: Very easy to get around in The staff at the stations are very help The train system is not as big as London or New York but it serves Bangkok well

title: I am a resident here in Thailand and Lived in Bangkok for 7 years. Now I live in the NorthEast province of Ubon Ratchath
review: The Sky train is a the local city transport system and they also have the underground called the MRT Both services pretty much covers Bangkok Very easy to get around in  Its better to use this service than taxi or bus because the traffic is horrendous in the city Reading the train map and connections is very easy The staff at the stations are very help this also includes the security guards who are all eager to help with a smile    The trains fares vary from destination to destination and all electronic ticket style card machines are in English as well You just cannot get lost The train system is not as big as London or New York but it serves Bangkok well  As mentioned I am a full time resident here in Thailand so the dates that has been mentioned  is incorrect because that's how far the tripadvisor goes back to August 2012 I have been here since February 2004
opinion: The staff at the stations are very helpful, this also includes the security guards who are all eager to help with a smile

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: Excellent way of getting around in Bangkok but avoid rush hours 08000900 and 17001930 hrs when it can get pretty crowded
opinion: The review does not express an opinion about safety.

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: Excellent way of getting around in Bangkok but avoid rush hours 08000900 and 17001930 hrs when it can get pretty crowded
opinion: Excellent way of getting around in Bangkok

title: A nice way to travel
review: The sky train is the easiest way to travel bangkok s overly congested streets and they are clean and air conned so a nice respite from the heat and humidity of thailands capital The sky train takes in most of bangkok s downtown and also has a airport stop for those who don't want to sit in traffic A great way to see bangkok
opinion: The sky train is the easiest way to travel Bangkok's overly congested streets

title: A nice way to travel
review: The sky train is the easiest way to travel bangkok s overly congested streets and they are clean and air conned so a nice respite from the heat and humidity of thailands capital The sky train takes in most of bangkok s downtown and also has a airport stop for those who don't want to sit in traffic A great way to see bangkok
opinion: The sky train is clean

title: Exxtremely convinient mode of transport
review: The Bangkok Sky Train and MRT are two of the best ways to enter the city right from Airport The Network is being expanded however its adequate enough to reach main shopping destinations office areas and places of interest Its very cost effective and fast (as there is no dependancy on traffic) Would highly recommend for the people on their shopping spree and business related work
opinion: Highly recommend for the people on their shopping spree and business related work

title: Exxtremely convinient mode of transport
review: The Bangkok Sky Train and MRT are two of the best ways to enter the city right from Airport The Network is being expanded however its adequate enough to reach main shopping destinations office areas and places of interest Its very cost effective and fast (as there is no dependancy on traffic) Would highly recommend for the people on their shopping spree and business related work
opinion: Cost effective and fast

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Revolutionising transportation in Bangkok for almost 14 years Quality construction and almost faultless in use the BTS Skytrain is now a victim of its own success Solid with passengers most of the day with Siam Station struggling to cope with the sheer volume However there is no real alternative unless you have all day for a relatively short journey Extended over the river into Thonburi and almost all the way south to Bang Na Buy a "stored value ticket" and travel when you like for several days If you don't get off you can travel and sightsee Bangkok getting off the train anywhere with no charge or penalties just pay the distance to your final destination Probably the most economical sightseeing trip in the world A mixture of the original Siemens trains with new Chinese ones Try and imagine what it was like without it all day for a trip to MBK
opinion: The BTS Skytrain is a convenient way to travel around Bangkok.

title: Skytrain
review: Certainly beats the traffic although slower than the MRT (underground)  Also note the stations are open air so expect the sweat on most days if waiting at any station  Extremely crowded and chaotic than MRT
opinion: Slower than the MRT, crowded and chaotic

title: Takes you where you need to go
review: The BTS Skytrain is a great form of public transportation to get to and fro around Bangkok  The trains stop at most major areas are are either right where you need to go or only a block or 2 away  Very clean and very affordable  Get a 1 day pass with unlimited rides  The kiosks and machines can be a little confusing to the first timers  There is security always around to keep things safe at all hours of the day and night  The same goes for the MRT (subway)  The BTS stations all have little shops and places to get snacks and drinks  Many even have restrooms and camera shops travel agents etc
opinion: Very clean and very affordable

title: Efficient and clean
review: I was very impressed with the skytrain on our last visit to Bangkok  The trains are punctual clean and nice and cool due to the air conditioning inside  I was surprised to step out of the intense heat and into cooled comfort  The train stops along all of the major parks and shopping areas and is very convenient if you are staying in central Bangkok    I was traveling with an 18 month old on the last trip and had a strollerbuggy which wasn't the greatest for maneuvering around the city anyway but I found that many of the stops had elevators although these could be difficult to find at times
opinion: Very impressed with the punctuality

title: Efficient and clean
review: I was very impressed with the skytrain on our last visit to Bangkok  The trains are punctual clean and nice and cool due to the air conditioning inside  I was surprised to step out of the intense heat and into cooled comfort  The train stops along all of the major parks and shopping areas and is very convenient if you are staying in central Bangkok    I was traveling with an 18 month old on the last trip and had a strollerbuggy which wasn't the greatest for maneuvering around the city anyway but I found that many of the stops had elevators although these could be difficult to find at times
opinion: Very impressed with the cleanliness

title: Easy travelling within the city
review: Well a city like Bangkok of course also needs an adequate public transport system Especially as the streets are already packed the air is polluted While there are busses available they have to deal with same traffic conditions So a skytrain was the best the government could came up with and so it's the fastest easiest and perhaps also sustainable way to travel within Bangkok city
opinion: Skytrain is the fastest, easiest, and perhaps also sustainable way to travel within Bangkok city

title: Fantastic
review: Best travelling tip is to stay somewhere close to transport and the BTS is fantastic transport  We purchased a 15 trip rabbit card which is great value  The BTS can take you basically anywhere in Bangkok in relative comfort and with high efficiency
opinion: The BTS is fantastic transport

title: Getting around Bangkok
review: Fast and easy way to get around in Bangkok Trains run very frequently Stations are near to many attractions some such as Paragon Centre accessed direct from the platform Changing lines simple and signs good when you get used to the map Using coins for tickets cumbersome but when you know the coinage and check fare on the machine quite acceptableFind out about day tickets etc Fares are very cheap compared with taxis and usually quicker Important  can be crowded so don't hang back grab a seat when you can
opinion: Fast and easy way to get around in Bangkok Trains run very frequentlyStations are near to many attractions Changing lines simple and signs good when you get used to the map Fares are very cheap compared with taxis and usually quicker Important  can be crowded so don't hang back grab a seat when you can

title: The only way to travel!
review: Convenient fast and able to get to most locations without a traffic jam try the BTS Even for the new traveller this network is easy to navigate and has both English and Thai explanation at ticket machines or staff on standby to help with change or information
opinion: Convenient, fast and able to get to most locations without a traffic jam.

title: Fab travel on Skytrain
review: We travel to Bangkok often and love getting around the city via Skytrain quick cheap reliable and immaculately clean Also very cool in a vibrant but very hot city The Skytrain link from Bangkok airport to the city is also excellent and far quicker than taking a taxi to the city centre when you are shattered after a long haul flight We travel independently and have found it just as easy as using a travel agent and far more fun We have stayed in many areas of the city on our many visits so that we can get to know it better and  to recuperate from jet lag for a few days before travelling around different parts of Thailand   However if one wants an easy time of going out shopping from ones hotel try Hotel Asia it is a bit older and more dated than some but it has the advantage of having a Skytrain station (Ratchetewi my spelling is probably not accurate) immediately outside its second floor so it is a matter of leaving one lot of air conditioning into another and when coming back with loads of shopping its straight off Skytrain into the hotel Easy Also try the weekend market at Chatterchuck Again very easy from Hotel Asia aboard Skytrain It is a huge market but beware easy to get lost in it if you dont have a good sense of direction Thailand is a fascinating place and its people are lovely truly 'The Land of the Smile'
opinion: The Skytrain is immaculately clean.

title: Fab travel on Skytrain
review: We travel to Bangkok often and love getting around the city via Skytrain quick cheap reliable and immaculately clean Also very cool in a vibrant but very hot city The Skytrain link from Bangkok airport to the city is also excellent and far quicker than taking a taxi to the city centre when you are shattered after a long haul flight We travel independently and have found it just as easy as using a travel agent and far more fun We have stayed in many areas of the city on our many visits so that we can get to know it better and  to recuperate from jet lag for a few days before travelling around different parts of Thailand   However if one wants an easy time of going out shopping from ones hotel try Hotel Asia it is a bit older and more dated than some but it has the advantage of having a Skytrain station (Ratchetewi my spelling is probably not accurate) immediately outside its second floor so it is a matter of leaving one lot of air conditioning into another and when coming back with loads of shopping its straight off Skytrain into the hotel Easy Also try the weekend market at Chatterchuck Again very easy from Hotel Asia aboard Skytrain It is a huge market but beware easy to get lost in it if you dont have a good sense of direction Thailand is a fascinating place and its people are lovely truly 'The Land of the Smile'
opinion: The Skytrain is quick, cheap, reliable, immaculately clean, and very cool in a hot city.

title: Easy, Safe and very convienient
review: if you carry a map of the BTS and MRT (BTS is skytrain and MRT is Underground) I am sure you would not need to take taxi or alternate transport for you trip  In Bangkok where the traffic can be chaotic most of the times this is a boon for travellers
opinion: Carrying a map of the BTS and MRT is a boon for travelers in Bangkok.

title: Easy, Safe and very convienient
review: if you carry a map of the BTS and MRT (BTS is skytrain and MRT is Underground) I am sure you would not need to take taxi or alternate transport for you trip  In Bangkok where the traffic can be chaotic most of the times this is a boon for travellers
opinion: Carrying a map of the BTS and MRT is convenient for avoiding taxis and other transportation in Bangkok's chaotic traffic.

title: Efficient
review: Very effective travel system around the city The roads are very bad in the city for traffic so having the sky train is essential for a modern city Although there's not many lines now they are extending and making new lines Long may the expansion continue  The AC is superb is such a hot city
opinion: Very effective travel system around the city

title: BTS- lifeline of Bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain is the safest most comfortable and convenient way to get around Bangkok  a comfortable ride through central Bangkok  lifting commuters above the chronic congestion noise and pollution of the streets below  There are two BTS line 1) Silom line 2) Sukhamvit line SILOM LINE runs west to south between the National Stadium in the Siam shopping area to Wongwian Yai in ThonburSUKHUMVIT LINE runs north to east from Mo Chit to Bearing
opinion: The BTS Skytrain is the safest way to get around Bangkok

title: BTS- lifeline of Bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain is the safest most comfortable and convenient way to get around Bangkok  a comfortable ride through central Bangkok  lifting commuters above the chronic congestion noise and pollution of the streets below  There are two BTS line 1) Silom line 2) Sukhamvit line SILOM LINE runs west to south between the National Stadium in the Siam shopping area to Wongwian Yai in ThonburSUKHUMVIT LINE runs north to east from Mo Chit to Bearing
opinion: The BTS Skytrain is the safest, most comfortable and convenient way to get around Bangkok.

title: Quick easy to navigate
review: We used this a few times to get quickly around Bangkok quick cheap and easy to use Would recommend
opinion: Quick, cheap, and easy to use

title: Easy to use, safe comfortable and fast
review: This is a tourists dream in Bangkok  If you are use to mass transport systems this is no different and signage is clear and easy to read  No traffic jams and speedy travel in a congested city
opinion: Easy to use mass transit system with clear signage and no traffic jams

title: fastest form of transportation
review: Definitely the fastest way to reach any corner of Bangkok if the sky train goes there It‚Äôs fast and very comfortable In fact if you plan to travel a lot during a particular day buy a day ticket it will fall cheaper
opinion: Definitely the fastest way to reach any corner of Bangkok

title: Excellent way of beating the traffic
review: Skytrain's got to be one of the better public transit systems in the region if not the world The trains are very clean and the Thais certainly know their public transport manners very well The tickets are also very reasonablypriced but during offpeak hours when traffic's a little smoother taking a cab might be a cheaper option of getting around town The system also covers a large area of Bangkok and a good number (but not all) of popular tourist attractions in the city  BTS is great but one thing I wish they could improve on only some of the stations are equipped with escalators it'd be nice if they provided them at all their stations An extension is also overdue another line or two wouldn't hurt really considering that many parts of Bangkok are still beyond the reach of its mass transit systems (MRT & BTS)
opinion: Tickets are also very reasonably priced

title: BTS at Asoke
review: Close to my hotel the Rembrant and easy to get to all areas One station to Emporium shopping and only a couple of stops to Siam
opinion: Close to my hotel the Rembrant and easy to get to all areas.

title: Skytrain to many places
review: Fantastic way to get aboutnot too dear though buses are cheaperHowever the skytrain is superbly efficientvery safe and runs very frequently There are Securicor guards on every platform and antiterrorist checksThere are 2 stations which connect with the equally efficient Subway trains(sign symbol a letter 'M')With a recent extensionit not only goes to the Chao Phrya river(Satorn station)where you can connect with a very cheap public ferry(great way to see Bangkok) but now carries on ACROSS the river to Wong Wian Waisoon to go even further away from the riverThe ticket macines take Thai 10 baht coins or 5 baht coins(change available from nearby office window)You can also take a skytrain to Chatuchak satsun marketthe biggest you'll ever see selling everything you could possibly wantJust secure your valuables before going into the busy alley ways as pickpockets are activeNo trouble otherwise and very safe
opinion: Very safe and runs very frequently There are Securicor guards on every platform and antiterrorist checksNo trouble otherwise and very safe

title: the best transport in bangkok but....
review: missed the train don't worry the next train will be reaching very soon it's really the fastest transport to travel around the city Only that the machines receive only coins of 10baht and 5 baht very troublesome especially during peak hours and also it's more expensive than taking taxi
opinion: The review doesn't express an opinion about safety.

title: Inexpensive, safe and easy to navigate
review: The stops of the 2 skytrain lines are at locations convenient to tourist sites Skytrain has ac and a very easy system in each train to know which station you are at Try to get a 30 day15 trips pass to save some funds and the hassle of having to "top up" the card (can only be bought at the ticket counter not at machine) and if you need to pair it with an MRT pass for the metro (3day tourist pass for MRT is THB 230 also bought at ticket counters at MRT stations) Between skytrain MRT and a few THB for ferries you can cover all sites in Bangkok
opinion: The stops of the 2 skytrain lines are at locations convenient to tourist sites.

title: Above the Congestion
review: Take the Skytrain whenever possible  It is well run clean fully staffed and easy to understand Prices are very reasonable  I only wish that it would go to more areas  Loved it
opinion: Well run, clean, fully staffed and easy to understand

title: Great way to travel around BKK, wish there were more lines
review: Love love love it as it is new wellmaintained and reasonably priced A few things to improve More frequant trains during rush hours More extensions to more remote locations
opinion: Love love love it as it is new, well-maintained, and reasonably priced.

opinion: Easy to move around Bangkok, much better than being stuck in a taxi.

title: 1st class
review: On time and was very cheap way to get around clean very fast as from the weekend market to Lumpini Park it got us there in around 15 mins or so
opinion: On time

title: 1st class
review: On time and was very cheap way to get around clean very fast as from the weekend market to Lumpini Park it got us there in around 15 mins or so
