title: First tip to travel in Bangkok - get the Skytrain
review: There's no doubt that the traffic in BKK will get you down But everything changes when you get to the Skytrain The problem for casual Skytrain users is that each time you take a new journey you have to buy a ticket Apart from waiting in long queues this requires having the right coins in your pocket or another trip to the change office The simplest way to travel is to get the Skytrain Pass for easy progress through the ticket lines (The Skytrain Pass has recently changed to become the Rabbit Pass) The pass will save you lots of time in the queues and can be used in other outlets too  Purchase the Rabbit at the Change Office for 200 baht with 150 baht credit (this is an introductory price so be cool with any changes after 31December 2012)
opinion: The Skytrain Pass (now Rabbit Pass) is convenient for frequent users because it eliminates the need to buy tickets each time, saving time in queues.

title: Great way to get around
review: I don't know how Bangkok survived before the invention of the sky train Busy yet clean and cool great way to get around the city and connect with the MRT
opinion: Bangkok wouldn't have survived without the sky train

title: Great way to get around
review: I don't know how Bangkok survived before the invention of the sky train Busy yet clean and cool great way to get around the city and connect with the MRT
opinion: The sky train is clean.

title: Not so perfect
review: if you are alone its good A family would rather prefer risking getting ripped by a cabbie instead of walking to the station walking up paying quite a bit waiting  3  7 minutes  then walking again  the pros are that it beats the Bangkok traffic and the Aircon is a relief on a hot day
opinion: It is not safe to walk to the station alone.

title: Easy to get around
review: The Skytrain is the best way to get around Bangkok Quick and clean and once you get the hang of how it runs it is a breeze to get around Very inexpensive for the value
opinion: The Skytrain is quick and clean.

title: Easy to get around
review: The Skytrain is the best way to get around Bangkok Quick and clean and once you get the hang of how it runs it is a breeze to get around Very inexpensive for the value
opinion: The Skytrain is the best way to get around Bangkok

title: Clean safe and Cheap
review: When in BKK you have the BTS and MRT they are both clean super cheap and usually cheaper that taking a taxi   Very efficient and highly recommended
opinion: Clean and super cheap

title: Efficient travel
review: easy to hop on and off  stations are easy to access even for disabled people Relatively esay to navigate from the airport so highly recommended if you do not want the hassle of taxi drivers
opinion: Easy to hop on and off, stations are easy to access even for disabled people, Relatively easy to navigate from the airport

title: Efficient travel
review: easy to hop on and off  stations are easy to access even for disabled people Relatively esay to navigate from the airport so highly recommended if you do not want the hassle of taxi drivers
opinion: Stations are easy to access even for disabled people

title: The Best Public Transport I've Used!
review: I used to live in Bangkok and the BTS is essential for most locals It'll get you to most places you need to go in a fairly good amount of time especially compared to driving It's air conditioned which is nice for Bangkok heat and is attached to lots of shopping centers and hotels via its SkyWalk My dad and I are mall rats and would use our BTS cards (we got them before the Rabbit card was invented I recommend you get one of those if you visit now no matter how long your trip) to go through the Chit Lom BTS station and on to the SkyWalk for shopping If you go to Bangkok I recommend you try to skip the sometimesscamming taxis and use the Skytrain as much as possible to beat the mad traffic
opinion: It is safe to use the BTS Skytrain.

title: Easy and cheap to get around
review: I found the Skytrain to be the cheapest and easiest way to get about in Bangkok As long as you have a map of the different stations and lines you won't have a problem  It is regular and has icy cold air conditioning  Don't spend half a day in taxis or tuk tuks just hop on the skytrain
opinion: Found the Skytrain to be the cheapest and easiest way to get about

title: the best public transportation in Bangkok
review: A very fast very often clean and cheap transportaion 2 lines Silom & Sukhumvit with a lot of stations Not depending on the famous Bangkok traffic Jams
opinion: Very fast, clean, and cheap transportation.

title: Great way to get around

title: Easy to navigate

title: Great though limited
review: Even the novice traveler can negotiate the best way around downtown Bangkok even though its scope is limited  Signage in both Thai and English are readily understood and there are always helpful Thais around eager to speak English  Crowded at rush hours  Make sure to get coins at the booths on the side before using the automated fare card kiosks in the center of the platform
opinion: Helpful Thais around eager to speak English

title: Fastest way to commute around/into heart of Bangkok
review: BTS is definitely the fastest and safest way to commute aroundinto heart of Bangkok  Fastest  Hell yeah you know all how bad the traffic in Bangkok is regardless of time Morning afternoon evening or even late night And if it rains it get twice as worse  Safest  I feel sorry for foreignertourists that get tricked by taxi and tuk tuk (3wheel taxi) I'm not saying all of them are bad but there are plenty of them that like playing trick with you trying to cheat the taxi fee So why not BTS Price is right there You can't cheat the system I believe the fee starts from 15 baht (about $050 USD) and goes up to 40 baht ($ 125) If you like to oneday pass it's 130 baht The great benefit of oneday pass is that you don't need to line up to buy tickets every time that's very convenient especially during rush hours  Trust me you won't be disappointed
opinion: I feel sorry for foreignertourists that get tricked by taxi and tuk tuk (3wheel taxi) I'm not saying all of them are bad but there are plenty of them that like playing trick with you trying to cheat the taxi fee So why not BTS

title: Bangkok by Skytrain
review: Skytrain travel is cheap quick and no traffic to worry about you just can't fault this systemall the places that one would travel to before Skytrain was by Taxiskytrain takes you to most places that tourist visit and to be honest there is nothing to dislike every train is clean and the service on the station regards ticket ect is very good
opinion: Skytrain travel is cheap, quick, and no traffic to worry about.

title: best way to explore.
review: Best cheap fast cool comfort very efficient  BTS Travelling by taxi is a nightmare with constant traffic jams A waste of time At Victory Monument BTS  go to 1]  Siam station  5 mins 20b Here is Siam Center Siam Discovery Siam Paragon famous MBK just across the road Short walk to Platinum Plaza Pratunam side street market Panthip Plaza and Baiyoke side street shopping 2]  Mo Chit  15 mins 30b Adjoins famous Chatuchuk weekend market 3]  Nana station  10 mins 25b See famous Nana Plaza with discos bars and more  4]  Taksin station  15 mins 30b Adjoining the Chao Phraya riverfront and River City Take escalator down to ferry terminal Free ferry shuttle across the river to Asiatique esplanade at nights  an immense waterfront upmarket centre for music lounges live music bars restaurants boutiques artworks food stalls with excellent Thai Western food desserts and more Good for the family Worth the experience No naughty stuff here 5]  Sukhumvit station  7 mins 25b Explore this place with all it's famous terrific barsnight lifediscos
opinion: Best cheap fast cool comfort very efficient

title: Simple and Fast Transportation
review: This was the cleanest and best public transportation I have ever been on  The system is cheap easy to use and the trains were very frequent  It was great that the stops were near boarding for water taxis and you could get all over the town using them  The AC was also a huge plus going cross town while keeping cool was a major bonus
opinion: This was the cleanest public transportation I have ever been on

title: ultra clean and reliable

title: Excellent Transport System

title: Best option to travel in Bangkok - BTS Rocks
review: If you are travelling alone or in a couple you may travel in Bangkok by sky trains as the service is pretty good and in most of the locations the sky train stations what is locally called BTS is connected directly to the reputed big shopping malls so that you can directly enter the same from BTS Reputed malls like Siam Paragon MBK Tokyu etc are all connected with BTS  Specially nowadays the Tuktuk or the local taxis started demanding excessive fares from the tourists and are not interested to go on meter basis Sometimes to travel a distance 2 kms they demand THB300400 which is very high Their new technique is to blame the road jam and ask excessive money from the tourists Thus BTS is a cheaper option for convenient and fast travelling
opinion: BTS is a cheaper option for convenient and fast travelling

title: Great mode of transportation
review: Bangkok's sky train is a fantastic way to travel avoiding the notorious traffic jam of the city Its all very posh looking and well maintained however signs could be a bit confusing provided people dont speak much of English If you would want to change line that just adds to the confusion in the absense of clear direction All the more consufing when trains leave in both direction from the same platform But its very clean and cold really great for scorching bangkok heat Its also connected with the river taxi pier (Saphan Taksin) which is really convenient if you jump on the boat But lack of escalator makes it a bit inconvenient specially if you cant do stairs But day pass only if you are making tht many trips to make it cost effective otherwise single ride ticket is fine
opinion: Very clean and cold really great for scorching Bangkok heat

title: Supremely efficient transport option
review: This is the most sophisticated system very easy to navigate Very helpful maps easily available clean & feels very safe Money can be changed for coins at ticket purchase point & the travel is so inexpensive compared with taxi Dovetails with the metro system and easily gets you around Cuts through the centre of Bangkok in a flash Can be very crowded but the people effortlessly make space for everyone who needs it as they are so very polite I just LOVE this system

title: The best way to travel within Bangkok, if you're staying in the Sukhumvit/Siam area
review: The skytrain is fast efficient airconditioned and helps you beat Bangkok's terrible traffic It also connects to a couple of MRT underground train stations so for longer journeys you can easily switch to the even faster MRT trains
opinion: The skytrain is fast, efficient, airconditioned and helps you beat Bangkok's terrible traffic.

title: Best and favorite way to get around Bangkok

title: Best mode of transportation in Bangkok city
review: The infamous traffic jam in bangkok is the biggest reason the Sky Train (and also subway) is the best and the fastest mode of transportation It is also cheap and aplenty The network is quite impressive (sufficient for tourists to move about in generally most places in Bangkok city) During rush hour it can get packed but the frequencey of the trains are also increased The sukhumvit line is the most busiest with Siam station being the most busiest as it is the centre node  Choose hotels near to BTS and accessibility is in your hands it will save you precious time
opinion: The Sky Train and subway are the best and fastest mode of transportation because of their accessibility.

title: Convenient

title: No Social Distancing,  on BTS trains
review: The BTS trains are a vital component of Bangkok's lifestyle but the Social Distancing measures have  to improve I don't know how this can be doneunless they have more staff stopping people from  hurrying into the trains especially during RushHour Although there are continuous announcements about  wearing masks not talkingnot facing each other the insides of the trains are a bit too crowdedfor comfort The seats are not socially distanced  at all I hope the BTS  organisation take this seriously Thailand is lucky to be Covidfree for more than 80 daysBut this Virus just can't be taken for granted especially  in the public transport system
opinion: Social Distancing measures have to improve

title: Frequent Trains, Clean, Safe, Stops Announced in Thai & English
review: Not the cheapest transportation but very easy if you're heading anywhere near a stop or want to combine it with Grab Taxi If you get a seat you'll have some nice views of the city I used it frequently enough during my twoweek stay to invest in a Rabbit card but there's a fee for the card and no discounts for the fare so it's better to purchase individual trips or a day pass if you won't use it often (Rabbit doesn't work any other public transportation including the metro so not a general transportation pass)   We stayed at a hotel near the Asok station in Sukumvit so it was easier and faster to take a SkyTrain out of the jammed packed traffic area than a taxi With two or more people taxi is cheaper though River ferries water taxis and the MRT can help you connect with some of the stops A great option for getting around especially if you're alone
opinion: Very easy if you're heading anywhere near a stop or want to combine it with Grab Taxi

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: I moved to Bangkok 8 months ago In previous visits to research where I wanted to live I quickly realized that while taxis are inexpensive the rides can prove very frustrating Bangkok has some of the most frequent and worst traffic jams in the world However the BTS (elevated train system) and the MRT (subway system) are clean efficient air conditioned and easy to use I rented a condo near the Asok BTS station and Sukhumvit MRT station I use these systems daily They are inexpensive run frequently  sometimes at peak travel times trains run every 25 minutes You can either buy tickets from machines for individual trips or reloadable cards from the ticket windows I recommend the cards as the ticket lines can sometimes be long I always reload the cards when I notice lines at a particular station are short or nonexistant Unfortunately you need separate cards for each system but it's a minor inconvenience The trains and subways can be very crowded at peak times 910 AM &  48 PM on weekdays depending on the direction you are going I have always found both systems to be reliable and safe I've had no experiences with myself or anyone I heard of having trouble with pickpockets or thieves But you should always be alert to those possibilities when traveling in crowded situations The BTS website is informative and easy to navigate
opinion: The BTS and MRT are clean and efficient.

title: Fast, cheap and with air conditioning!!
review: This is basically Bangkok‚Äôs London Underground but better   Why it‚Äôs better    stations are NUMBERED so it‚Äôs easy to know when to get off where you are etc   the price IS the destination  At first very strange but then you realise it‚Äôs genius  You‚Äôre standing at the ticket thing you press the button next to the name of your destination ON the button is a number That IS the cost to that location from your location How simple is that   Well it would be but my western brain took a while to figure it out That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm telling you here   air conditioning No need to say more We all want this on all the underground lines   phone signal Yes you can face time and chat in LINE while on the skytrain Everyone does and you should take a look around and do some shoulder surfing while your there   Bad points   It‚Äôs a bit busy pretty much all the time  There are very few payment kiosks  There was only one exit gate to put your ticket in But it manages No idea what happens when it breaks though
opinion: This is basically Bangkok's London Underground but better, stations are NUMBERED so it‚Äôs easy to know when to get off, where you are etc, the price IS the destination, at first very strange but then you realise it‚Äôs genius.

title: Best way to get around
review: Don‚Äôt be tricked by taxi with no meters or TukTuks with ‚Äúonly one stop‚Äù Be brave  use the sky train   It‚Äôs cheap  and you can buy a day pass too It‚Äôs extremely easy to work Clean quick and I don‚Äôt understand why so few tourists use it   Maps are everywhere and most popular tourist spots tell you which BTS they are located on   Even if you‚Äôre staying on Sukhumvit and want to visit the Grand Palace  don‚Äôt book a tour yes it‚Äôs in the other side of the city but it‚Äôs 30mins on the MRT (underground  located at Asoke) or the BTS and change at Siam   Just do it  I promise it‚Äôs really easy My parents came to visit me when I lived there I left them in Bangkok for a day to go back to work  they loved the BTS and could even navigate it after a few (lot) of beer It may be a little stressful if you did it with small children though

review: An excellent mode of transport to get around Bangkok and avoid the traffic jams  If the sky train doesn't go directly to your destination I would suggest using it to get to as close to your destination as possible then pick up a taxi for remainder of journey again saving on time sitting in traffic jams Be aware traffic is horrendous in Bangkok but the sky train runs frequently is clean and feels safe at all times of the day It's also air conditioned  There are manned booths to help with travel costdirections give change as well as self service ticket machines
opinion: Feels safe at all times of the day

title: Clean

opinion: Very clean and new

title: Well co-ordinated life line of the city. Very crowded in office hours.
review: The trains move within restricted routes of the city One called the Sukhumvit line and the other Silom line The changeover is at Siam Most of the stations are interconnected to nearby shopping malls and hotels thus making it convenient to use in inclement weather Also there are bike taxis which operate from the inner lanes to the BTS station making it a smooth and fast journey There are certain stations like Asoke (Sukhumvit Line)  and Sala Daeng (Silom Line) which are connected to the underground MRT Paya Thai BTS is connected to the Airport Rail Link connecting the city to Suvarnabhumi Airport
opinion: The trains move within restricted routes of the city.

title: Very convenient
review: I always use the sky train when I land in Bangkok it's really convenient and fast aswell as an extremely affordable way to get into Bangkok CBD I would recommend this over taking a taxi or a cab unless you have a very large budget the taxis and cabs tend to charge ridiculous prices and because bangkok is so busy it takes way longer aswell  Along with everything being written in Thai there is also English writing underneath it so it's easy to understand where you are and where you need to get off

title: Stay close to the BTS and you'll be fine!
review: The best way of transportation in Bangkok without a doubt I always ensure to book hotels close to the BTS whenever visiting Bangkok Also combining transportation with a taxi app like Uber or Grab can really enhance your stay in BKK I don't enjoy the energy consuming task of negotiating about taxi meter vs fixed prices The only negative aspect about the BTS is that it can be quite expensive after several trips in one day which is not unusual
opinion: BTS is convenient

title: Fast and Fabulous!
review: Want to get around we without being stuck in the Bangkok traffic for a fraction of the price Take the train Clean fast and efficient  If you dont mind a bit of cultural experience and see how the locals travel go for it Easy access to getting around the city the trains are air conditioned and get you around in a jiffy Do be mindful of peak times as the trains can get crowded The ticket counters and signage is clearly marked in English so any traveller will not get confused  There are not many people who are very familiar with English and asking around may be a hit and a miss so make sure you have a map and can point to people where you want to go  Crowded trains can be a haven for pick pockets so be sensibly cautious of your belongings and your wallet I had a very positive experience but it doesn't harm to be a sensible traveller and take home positive memories of this tantalizing country called Thailand  Bon Voyage and safe travels
opinion: Clean, fast and efficient

title: Excellent Way to travel
review: Great way to travel around Bangkok We used this a few times during our stay Easy to navigate and value for money Really good for getting to Eastern Bus terminal and Mo Chit Nicely air conditioned and great to see the city from above  If getting to it from the River Taxis  get off at Central Pier you can walk to the sky train from there
opinion: Easy to navigate and value for money Really good for getting to Eastern Bus terminal and Mo Chit Nicely air conditioned If getting to it from the River Taxis  get off at Central Pier you can walk to the sky train from there

title: Two nights in Bangkok!
review: Sky train was great Cheap and efficient As foreigners we found it a bit confusing to start with and were unsure where to wait for train but we soon got the hang of it  Highly patronised so even during what we considered off peak there was standing room only Would recommend you plan your journey before leaving home so you know what to ask for and which direction you need to be going in  Overall a fun experience that got us where we wanted to go
opinion: Cheap and efficient Highly patronised Would recommend you plan your journey before leaving home Overall a fun experience

title: Great but there are snags ...
review: It was an amazing initiative of Bangkok to introduce the BTS System and it is now quite popular with every tourist I dare say  Staff are typically very helpful and there are machines as well  The fares are affordable but the annual increase stands in no relationship with the quality of service because trains are overloaded now during peak hours  Safety In recent years security gates have been installed and G4S guards have not been replaced by those In fact BTS have now got a security officer at every exit on some of the station Quite an intrusion into your privacy since they expect you to open your bags publicly  and they then do not really inspect anything  a bit pointless  The security at the platform and on the sky walk are mostly unreasonable For example taking photographs is an issue as they push you to move on  although there might be 20m wide and 500m long strips with not a single person in sight I am not sure why security officers would engage when there is no 'security concern' nor 'risk'  I am still enjoying my journeys and I hope you like my images
opinion: Enjoying journeys, concerned about security measures, particularly the bag checks and restrictions on photography.

title: Great system
review: Very impressed with BTS system and quality of service and trains  Easy to use  Very efficient and lots of lovely Thai ladies to brighten the day with their lovely smiles
opinion: Easy to use

title: Clean and affordable public transport.
review: Traveling on BTS is an easy way to get around Bangkok City You can get a farecard and top up at any station and the fare is just 25baht for around 4 stops   The only problem I have is when boarding at the exchange station where there are lots of passengers boarding and alighting but again it's an experience to commute like the locals   The trains are clean and the service staff at the station are very helpful in providing direction to which platform to take   Once you get out the ticketing gantry there are heaps of small stalls selling bites and drinks convenient to those who need a quick bite or thirsting for water
opinion: The trains are clean

title: Easy to use and quick
review: Simple easy to use and very quick cheaper than taxis and tuk tuks miss the misery of the Bangkok traffic jam and air conditioned bliss
opinion: Simple, easy to use and very quick

title: Easy way to travel
review: If you destinationsite is close to a BTS station then definitely take the BTS It's comfortable air conditioned and cheap  Definitely get the 1day unlimited pass (available as of this writing) if you'll be taking the BTS four times or more in one day Tickets can be purchased from the machines or booths (which tend to be quicker regardless of time of day)  How to use at the gates Insert your ticket wait a second then retrieve it when it pops out Now walk through the gate When exiting insert your ticket (the gate will keep it on your exit) and walk through the gate  Major downside of the BTS Trains run between 1015 minutes apart If you miss one it can feel like a very long wait in the Bangkok heat and humidity
opinion: Comfortable, air-conditioned, and cheap.

title: Easiest way to travel in Bangkok
review: Great experience easy to navigateticket machines on the station and cashiers who speak English   Prices very reasonable  At certain times peak office time it can be quite compact on the train however is a million times better than being stuck in the sea of a moving car park on all the roads below  It took 3 and a half hours stuck in the back of a taxi that I later learnt could have been travelled by BTS in 30 minutes at a fraction of the price    Check it out is definitely the fastest cleanest and a cheap way to travel
opinion: The fastest, cleanest, and cheapest way to travel

title: The fastest way to get around Bangkok and miss the traffic jams.
review: The BTS [SKYWAY] can get you quickly efficiently and cheaply to just about anywhere you want to go plus it has stations that interchange with both the MRT [underground] and the Suvamabhumi Airport Link For shopping we would get off at National Stadium for MBK centre and Siam Square1 and short walk to Siam Centre and Siam Paragon and the board at BTS Siam to travel back to our hotel at Sala Daeng On the weekend we took the BTS to Chatuchak market which is a short walk from BTS Mo Chit For our visit to the Grand Palace we took BTS to Saphan Taksin station then a short walk to Sathorn Pier and caught a ferry All the station exit signage is really clear and easy to follow this is the BEST way to get around Bangkok
opinion: The BTS [SKYWAY] is the BEST way to get around Bangkok.

title: USE IT IF you can!
review: BTS skytrain is a very comfortable way to travel around in Bangkok  It's quick runs frequently and its air conditioned And if you don't have too much luggage you can even take it from the new airport Just get away from the rush traffic that can take hours into the city  The weakness of BTS is that it only runs 2 lines  which mean that you might need to take a taxi after you get close to your endpoint but you might have saved a lot of time during the main part of you trip
opinion: BTS skytrain is a very comfortable way to travel

review: If you're on holiday the BTS is an excellent way to get around Bangkok Harder to get lost if the BTS can be seen in the distance Get a map showing stops and times Get a daylong pass then no waiting in line for each stop  Go when the Thai workers aren't going to work in the morning and more importantly when the go home If you do go when busiest and you're on vacation let the weary workers and ladies sit

title: Daily user

title: Best form of travel
review: The BTS is an absolute must if you plan on traveling around Bangkok  Not only will it keep you off the busy city streets  but it is a clean and enjoyable way to do what the natives do  Thousands of Bangkokians travel via the BTS everyday and it is understandable why The cars are clean  the facilities are in great shape  and things are always running on time  My family love getting onto the BTS anytime we want to go to the mall or one of the many city landmarks  If you are in Bangkok and haven't done so  try the BTS you will love it
opinion: The cars are clean

title: Sky train experience
review: My friend and I caught the sky train out to the Chatuchak Markets in Mo Chit  from the Surasak station  we had to change trains at the Siam Station  Before boarding the train you have to buy tokens that let you through the turn style There is a map showing the stations and how much money you need to get the tokens required There is also information offices to buy change from if you don't have the correct money and need help  We had to change trains at Siam Station which was a piece of cake The trains are pretty full but people are very respectful vacating seats for elderly and parents with children I found the whole experience hassle free and very easy The trains are clean and fast The frequency of the train schedule is every 4 minutes I believe And it was cheap it cost us 42 baht each for a one way journey I would definitely recommend BTS sky train travel
opinion: The trains are clean

title: Affordable, easy to navigate, and convenient!
review: I enjoy public transportation when in a new city being very familiar with DC NYC Boston and Los Angeles as well as London Paris Barcelona Madrid and others  As a firsttime visitor to Southeast Asia traveling alone I decided to try to master the public rail system on the first day and found it to be easy to navigate  Advice  if you are going to make more than 2 stops each way in a day always buy the 1day pass  In July 2017 it is 140 baht (less than $5)  With most trips being 2545 baht you quickly save money  But even on lower travel days the time saved of having to buy individual passes (first waiting in light to get change before getting in the line to buy the individual ticket) is worth the extra cost  I stayed in a hotel just off of Sukhumvit and found that to be a great location  easy access to many malls the Bangkok Arts & Culture Center the Jim Thompson House and Outlet Store weekend farmers markets and the Chatuchak Weekend Market  And even in going to places not on the BTS many connections were doable  I went to the Grand Palace and Wat Po by 2 trains and a ferry in going to a night market one night and a rooftop restaurant another it was an easy transfer to the MRT (although the two systems of passes are entirely different  one uses a coded card and the MRT uses a wooden token)  Sometimes the trains are VERY crowded but the status changes stop by stop And while people are pressed together occasionally there is no pushing or stress just crowding    I used the BTS system for a week in the heat of July and found the trains to always be well air conditioned  And the queuing system (platforms are marked with two rows of angled access from each side of each train door opening with a large exit area for deboarding) is the best I've seen anyplace in the world  Recommendations for improvement  merge the passtoken systems for BTS and MRT make it easier to buy multiple passes at the same time (both for going and coming as well as buying for 2 or more people traveling together) and make train maps more readily available  I picked one up at the airport information center and learned later that it was not replaceable at BTS stations  Advice  The specific Google Maps app on your smart phone allows you to plan trips using the Bangkok public transportation system (one trip at a time) whereas the Google maps app that is standard on an iPhone does not  It was great to have it for walking from a train stop to the location as it could track where you are and let you know if you're going the right direction (since I couldn't read Thai this was very helpful)
opinion: Train maps more readily available

title: Easy to get around
review: So easy  to get around on the sky train if you havent got a lot of luggage its a lot cheaper than taxi I think it is about 70 Thai bht and only takes 20 min from the airport to the centre of Bangkok and if you are already in the city it is so much cheaper than taxi and a lot faster and the BTS will not rip you off
opinion: So easy to get around on the sky train if you havent got a lot of luggage it is a lot cheaper than taxi

title: Simple, Easy, Cheap!
review: Best way to travel around Bangkok is the BTS  Its cheap clean efficient  Simple to use just look at the map and the station you want to travel to it will show you a number that is the cost on Baht for you to get there    Plan ahead so you know what station you want to get off at for the sites or activities you want to do  The Siam station is the main interchange for the two lines  Also Siam Paragon Mall is at the Siam Station great for shopping lunch movies etc
opinion: The BTS is cheap, clean, and efficient.

title: Simple, Easy, Cheap!
review: Best way to travel around Bangkok is the BTS  Its cheap clean efficient  Simple to use just look at the map and the station you want to travel to it will show you a number that is the cost on Baht for you to get there    Plan ahead so you know what station you want to get off at for the sites or activities you want to do  The Siam station is the main interchange for the two lines  Also Siam Paragon Mall is at the Siam Station great for shopping lunch movies etc
opinion: The BTS is cheap, clean, efficient, and simple to use.

title: Overhead rail service
review: A good popular overhead rail service although not very friendly if you are handicapped elderly or travelling with young children as most stations are only equipped with up escalators in limited locations   Linking travel on different lines can be inconvenirnt Unfortunately there is also no linked ticketing system with the underground rail service
opinion: Good overhead rail service, but not very friendly for handicapped, elderly, or those with young children due to limited accessibility features.  Linking travel on different lines can be inconvenient. There's also no linked ticketing system with the underground rail service.

title: Easy way of getting round!

opinion: Easy to use machines and the trains come every few minutes Not too busy and air conditioned
